description: Oksana Lintz, disturbed by rising city tensions and divisions, unlocks and decrypts Halden’s hidden spiral plan notebook. She reviews its message advocating citywide amnesty, local decision-making, and peer-led reconciliation.

Oksana delivers Halden’s spiral plan to the Council and releases it publicly, urging immediate adoption of forgiveness and self-correction. The Council, under mounting pressure, convenes to debate rapid rollout.
The Council votes to implement Halden’s spiral plan citywide, granting amnesty for all BCI violations and shifting focus to community arbitration and open forums.
Stenograd’s districts adopt peer-led arbitration and public amnesty rituals. Reports of restored cooperation and unexpected unity emerge, though some express uncertainty about lasting change.

As unity grows, Oksana discovers evidence suggesting Halden’s spiral plan may have been a final system test. Council and citizens begin to debate whether to trust his vision or demand an independent way forward.
